derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (especially representing the title given to the head of the Roman Empire): from Old French emperere, from Latin imperator 'military commander', from imperare 'to command', from in- 'towards' + parare 'prepare, contrive'

entry.def: An emperor is a man who rules an empire or is the head of state in an empire.

means.word_mean: 2. large moth of temperate forests of Eurasia having heavily scaled transparent wings
